Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior patchily glazed and much worn, showing white slip underneath; at top and bottom, pairs of faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx seated to left (possible trace of wing on left at top, body and hindquarters with faded red blob and part of tail remaining).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 858)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1116) (phase 2)
